subject: Smart & Get Things Done; Finding Technical Talent
credit: Smart & Get Things Done; Finding Technical Talent

todos.title: Resumes
todos.body: Look for passion, look for past selection programs, communication style, don’t look for experience with particular technologies.

todos.title: Startup
todos.body: Incentivize them to join your startup and make equity.

todos.title: Spouse Relocation
todos.body: Get them when their spouse relocates.

todos.title: Build a Community
todos.body: Build an accelerator, blog, code challenge, lunches, talks, parties.

todos.title: Smart But Don’t Get Things Done
todos.body: Work at colleges and big companies where there is no accountability.

todos.title: Hidden Market
todos.body: The best developers are never on the market.

todos.title: Phone Screen
todos.body: Talk to them on the phone before you interview in person.

todos.title: Send Letters
todos.body: Send personalized letters to computer science students.

todos.title: Elimination Course
todos.body: Hiring talent starts with a large pool and you narrow down by obstacles.  How can you eliminate as many obstacles as possible.

todos.title: Get them Early
todos.body: Get the students through internship programs with the coding schools.

todos.title: Obstacles
todos.body: Facilities, location, workspace, fair pay (justice), toys, co-workers, immigration.

todos.title: Reject a Good Candidate
todos.body: Better than accepting a bad candidate.

todos.title: Best Are Much Better
todos.body: Best programmers are three to four times faster than their peers.  Find them.

todos.title: Go to the Mountain
todos.body: Be where they are, conferences, organizations, neighborhoods, websites, gaming, colleges, on campus recruiting event.
